Hi, I'm Ben.

I’m an everything-thinker who finds peace amongst the chaos.

I consider myself a Swiss Army Knife ^I mean, my name isn't Jack anyway — I'm great at a lot of things — but I know when to hand it off to an expert.

My brain wears Nikes. ^Because its always running

I'm comfortable wrestling two-truths at once. Discomfort is where we grow. I like to think I can simplify complexity — cutting through the noise to find what actually matters.

I think deeply, explore broadly, and often ask too many questions. I'm a bit of an anarchist in all the right ways (your grandmother loves me).

That being said, sometimes being a menace is a me problem — but sometimes, it isn’t always my problem.

Wired Differently

Somewhere along the way, I came to understand that I’m twice-exceptional (2e) — a term used for those who are both Gifted and have another neurodivergent trait. For me, it's Giftedness + ADHD.

I was diagnosed with ADHD at five — but it wasn’t until recently I realised Giftedness is medically codified, not just a word for being good at stuff.

Being 2e means I default to thinking and operating outside the box. Always looking in and trying to understand:

How did the box earn its place on the shelf?
What is holding the box together?
Where did the box even come from?
Is it even the right box?

I don’t always slot neatly into systems — I need to understand them, test them, sometimes reassemble them — guided by curiosity and instinct. Put simply, I just see and interact with the world differently.

Wiring? Sure. Identity? Nah.
